item.title: Police arrest key suspect over stabbing eighth-grader to death in Rayerbazar
item.description: Police have arrested the key suspect over the brutal stabbing of an eighth-grade schoolgirl outside her home in Rayerbazar. The suspect, identified only as Siam, was arrested on Thursday morning at Kalabagan, said Dhanmondi Zone Assistant Commissioner Shah Mostafa Tarikuzzaman. “An FIR has

item.title: JCI Dhaka South announces new leadership for 2026
item.description: The annual general assembly of Junior Chamber International (JCI) Dhaka South was held on Wednesday at the Gulshan Club in the capital, marking a significant transition in leadership for the year 2026. During the ceremonial event, Md. Naeem Haider was formally announced as the local president of J

item.title: Bangladesh Bank incident signals ‘government-backed mob culture’, Jamaat chief says
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman has condemned the protests surrounding the former governor of Bangladesh Bank and his advisor, describing the events as the formal debut of a government-backed "mob culture". In a verified Facebook post on Thursday morning, the Leader of the Opposition in parl

item.title: Govt will establish liberal democratic state system to promote knowledge, science: PM
item.description: Prime Minister Tarique Rahman today said the current government will work to establish a liberal democratic state system with moral standards and dignity so that the country can move forward in all branches of knowledge and science, including education, literature, arts, science and technology. "I

item.title: DU metro rail station to remain closed for two hours for Book Fair Inauguration
item.description: The metro rail station at Dhaka University (DU) will remain closed for two hours on Thursday (today), centring the inauguration of the Amar Ekushey Book Fair by Prime Minister Tarique Rahman. During the closure, no passengers will be allowed to enter or exit the station, and no trains will stop th

item.title: Police arrest 100 during overnight Ramadan crackdown in Mohammadpur
item.description: Dhaka police have conducted a sweeping overnight operation in Mohammadpur and Adabor, arresting 100 suspected criminals as part of efforts to curb gangs, extortionists, and drug dealers. The raids, carried out from 10pm Wednesday to 2am Thursday, were aimed at restoring public safety, officers sai

item.title: Court directs authorities to seek Interpol red notice against British MP Tulip
item.description: A Dhaka court has directed authorities to initiate steps to request an Interpol red notice for British MP Tulip Siddiq, niece of former prime minister Sheikh Hasina. Metropolitan Senior Special Judge Md Sabbir Faiz passed the order on Wednesday, according to court bench assistant Riaz Hossain. Th

item.title: PM calls for depoliticising education, research, arts
item.description: Prime Minister Tarique Rahman on Thursday said education, research, arts and literature should remain free from political influence in a civilised society. "I believe that politicising education, research and the practice of arts and literature is never a mark of a civilised society," he said whil

item.title: Jamaat accuses President of oath breach
item.description: The opposition party Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami on Wednesday accused President Mohammed Shahabuddin of breaching his constitutional oath by allegedly disclosing internal and confidential matters in a recent newspaper interview, triggering fresh political debate. item.title: 4.8 magnitude earthquake jolts Bangladesh
item.description: An earthquake measuring 4.8 on the Richter scale was felt in several parts of Bangladesh at 12:04 pm on Thursday after an interval of nearly 13 hours, according to the United States Geological Survey (USGS). The epicentre was located in Gyalshing of West Sikkim in India, about 455 kilometres north

item.description: Dhaka police have conducted a sweeping overnight operation in Mohammadpur and Adabor, arresting 100 suspected criminals as part of efforts to curb gangs, extortionists, and drug dealers. item.title: Growing business of selling 'pure' products in Ramadan
item.description: Many things vary from generation to generation, but one thing is becoming exponentially more tiring: the lack of purity in our food. In this life full of hassle, all we can afford is polluted air and adulterated food. The urgency of this issue becomes even more profound during Ramadan, a mon
